elements.name: introText
elements.html:
Building a Sustainability Model

In this section, we will explore how to build a sustainability model that keeps your solution relevant and engages the community and stakeholders in the process.

elements.name: keyConceptsText
elements.html:
Key Concepts

Let's use an analogy to understand the right sustainability model needed.

elements.name: keyConceptsQuestion
elements.title: Which analogy best describes the early stages of building a solution?
choices: Building for Scale: The Commercial Jet

elements.name: rapidIdeationInfo
elements.html: Rapid Ideation: The Paper Airplane: In the early stages, building a solution is like creating a paper airplane. Quick prototyping and testing allow for rapid ideation and learning from failures. This phase is crucial for refining the idea and ensuring it meets initial requirements.

elements.name: buildingForScaleInfo
elements.html: Building for Scale: The Commercial Jet: As the solution matures beyond personal productivity, it transitions from a paper airplane to a commercial jet. This phase involves meeting rigorous standards and requirements, ensuring safety, reliability, and performance. Building for scale requires a robust infrastructure, comprehensive testing, and continuous improvement to keep the solution flying high.

elements.name: starterDiscussionText
elements.html:
Starter Discussion Questions

Consider how you currently ensure the sustainability of your solutions after the initial deployment:

elements.name: starterDiscussionQuestion
elements.title: Which of the following challenges have you faced in engaging stakeholders throughout the development process?

elements.name: starterDiscussionMoreInfo
elements.title: Are you familiar with these challenges?

elements.name: lackOfStakeholderInvolvementInfo
elements.visibleIf: {starterDiscussionMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {starterDiscussionQuestion} contains 'Lack of stakeholder involvement'
elements.html: Lack of Stakeholder Involvement: Engaging stakeholders from the beginning ensures that their needs and expectations are met. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, IT, and customer service, helps in creating a holistic solution that addresses various aspects of the business.

elements.name: misalignmentOfExpectationsInfo
elements.visibleIf: {starterDiscussionMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {starterDiscussionQuestion} contains 'Misalignment of expectations'
elements.html: Misalignment of Expectations: Clear communication and regular feedback loops help in aligning expectations and ensuring that the solution meets the needs of all stakeholders.

elements.name: communicationBarriersInfo
elements.visibleIf: {starterDiscussionMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {starterDiscussionQuestion} contains 'Communication barriers'
elements.html: Communication Barriers: Establishing clear communication channels and providing ongoing support and resources ensures that support teams feel comfortable handling any issues that may arise.

elements.name: continuousImprovementText
elements.html:
Continuous Improvement

Once the initial deployment is complete, the focus should shift to continuous improvement. This involves iterative development and feedback loops to adapt to changing business requirements.

elements.name: continuousImprovementQuestion
elements.title: Which of the following strategies do you use for continuous improvement?

elements.name: continuousImprovementMoreInfo
elements.title: Are you familiar with these strategies?

elements.name: iterativeDevelopmentInfo
elements.visibleIf: {continuousImprovementMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {continuousImprovementQuestion} contains 'Iterative Development'
elements.html: Iterative Development: Iterative development involves making small, incremental changes to the solution and continuously improving it based on feedback and new requirements.

elements.name: feedbackLoopsInfo
elements.visibleIf: {continuousImprovementMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {continuousImprovementQuestion} contains 'Feedback Loops'
elements.html: Feedback Loops: Feedback loops involve regularly collecting feedback from stakeholders, including users and customers, to identify areas for improvement and drive further enhancements.

elements.name: engagingStakeholdersInfo
elements.visibleIf: {continuousImprovementMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {continuousImprovementQuestion} contains 'Engaging Stakeholders'
elements.html: Engaging Stakeholders: Engaging stakeholders from the beginning ensures that their needs and expectations are met. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, IT, and customer service, helps in creating a holistic solution that addresses various aspects of the business.

elements.name: successfulHandoverText
elements.html:
Successful Handover to Support Teams

A successful handover to support teams is essential for the long-term sustainability of the solution. Comprehensive documentation and training sessions are key components of this process.

elements.name: successfulHandoverQuestion
elements.title: Which of the following strategies do you use for a successful handover to support teams?

elements.name: successfulHandoverMoreInfo
elements.title: Are you familiar with these strategies?

elements.name: comprehensiveDocumentationInfo
elements.visibleIf: {successfulHandoverMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {successfulHandoverQuestion} contains 'Comprehensive Documentation'
elements.html: Comprehensive Documentation: Clear and detailed documentation helps support teams understand the solution's intricacies and provides a reference for managing and maintaining it.

elements.name: trainingSessionsInfo
elements.visibleIf: {successfulHandoverMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {successfulHandoverQuestion} contains 'Training Sessions'
elements.html: Training Sessions: Training sessions build support teams' confidence in managing and maintaining the solution by providing hands-on experience and addressing any questions or concerns.

elements.name: clearCommunicationChannelsInfo
elements.visibleIf: {successfulHandoverMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {successfulHandoverQuestion} contains 'Clear Communication Channels'
elements.html: Clear Communication Channels: Establishing clear communication channels between development and support teams ensures that support teams feel comfortable handling any issues that may arise and can seek assistance when needed.

elements.name: automatedTestingText
elements.html:
The Role of Automated Testing

Automated testing plays a significant role in building sustainable applications. It helps in identifying issues early, ensuring the solution remains reliable and efficient.

elements.name: automatedTestingQuestion
elements.title: Which of the following benefits have you experienced with automated testing?

elements.name: automatedTestingMoreInfo
elements.title: Are you familiar with these benefits?

elements.name: earlyIssueDetectionInfo
elements.visibleIf: {automatedTestingMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {automatedTestingQuestion} contains 'Early Issue Detection'
elements.html: Early Issue Detection: Automated testing helps in identifying issues early in the development process, allowing for timely resolution and reducing the risk of major problems later on.

elements.name: improvedReliabilityInfo
elements.visibleIf: {automatedTestingMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {automatedTestingQuestion} contains 'Improved Reliability'
elements.html: Improved Reliability: Automated tests ensure that the solution remains reliable by continuously checking for issues and verifying that all features work as expected.

elements.name: efficientTestingProcessInfo
elements.visibleIf: {automatedTestingMoreInfo} = 'Not sure, tell me more' and {automatedTestingQuestion} contains 'Efficient Testing Process'
elements.html: Efficient Testing Process: Automated testing streamlines the testing process, making it more efficient and allowing for faster feedback on code changes.
